metadata.title: CVE-2022-1354 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap buffer overflow flaw was found in Libtiffs' tiffinfo.c inTIFFReadRawDataStriped() function. This flaw allows an attacker to pass acrafted TIFF file to the tiffinfo tool, triggering a heap buffer overflowissue and causing a crash that leads to a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1354` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.5
libtiff-tools - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.5
libtiff5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.5
libtiffxx5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.5').
